question:
Competitive SIS model over two multiplex layer A and B same set of nodes. the two memes are exclusive: A node cannot adopt meme 1 and meme 2 simultaneously. Beta 1 and delta 1 for layer 1 and beta2 and delta 2 for layer 2 Assume the effective adoption rates of each meme are larger than their no-sharing mean field threshold, i.e., ùúè1>1/ùúÜ1(ùê¥) and ùúè2>1/ùúÜ1(ùêµ).Question1-:  Will both memes survive (coexistence), or will one meme completely remove the other (absolute dominance)?2-which characteristics of a multilayer network structure allow for coexistence?
 This question need to be addressed analytically and then simulated to see if the analytical solutions are also valid by simualtion comprehensively.
 please do not ask the user any question, use other tools to address the question
next_plan:
We completed initial discovery, built two-layer network (BA + ER), formulated Competitive SIS model, ran several simulations with different parameter regimes. Results show extinction in one scenario, dominance in others, but no coexistence yet.

Next steps:
1. Analytical phase: derive survival and winning threshold equations using Sahneh & Scoglio framework; compute eigenvector overlap coefficient and predict outcome for our network; contrast with simulation.
2. Design new network pair with deliberately low overlap in dominant eigenvectors (e.g., assign hubs of one layer to peripheral nodes in other) to satisfy coexistence condition; implement via degree-swap algorithm.
3. Simulate competitive SIS with parameters above thresholds on new network; extract metrics; expect coexistence.
4. Perform correlation study varying overlap to map phase diagram (dominance vs coexistence).
5. Compile full LaTeX report incorporating analysis, simulation figures (results-11.png, results-12.png, results-13.png, plus new ones); cite literature: Sahneh2013, Sumathi2018, etc.
